p:
We next examined the results of our GWAS to identify novel candidate modifiers of PD motor subtype. Although no variants reached the genome-wide significance threshold, a number of variants showed suggestive associations ( p < 1 x 10 −5) with either PD motor subtype or subtype ratio (tables e-3 and e-4, links.lww.com/NXG/A373). The top variant associated with the subtype ratio outcome is rs2301857 ( p ratio = 6.6 x 10 −7), located within an intron of the STK32B gene ( figure 2). The minor allele, rs2301857
T (frequency = 0.12) was associated with reduced tremor/PIGD score ratio (effect = −0.19). Thus, the minor and major alleles for the rs2301857 SNP are associated with a polarization toward the PIGD vs TD phenotypes, respectively. In our complementary analysis, the association between rs2301857 and PD motor subtype was attenuated ( p subtype = 0.044).
